actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.

official_title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to allow an individual who receives a readjustment payment upon discharge from active duty with the Armed Forces as a member of the Reserves and who later becomes entitled to retired pay to repay the readjustment payment through partial, rather than total, reductions from such individual's retired pay.

summary.text: Requires an individual who receives a readjustment payment upon discharge from active duty with the Armed Forces as a member of the Reserves, and who later becomes entitled to retired pay to repay the readjustment payment from his or her retired pay in equal amounts over a period not to exceed ten years (immediate repayment is now required).

titles.title: A bill to amend title 10, United States Code, to allow an individual who receives a readjustment payment upon discharge from active duty with the Armed Forces as a member of the Reserves and who later becomes entitled to retired pay to repay the readjustment payment through partial, rather than total, reductions from such individual's retired pay.
